keyword: how many calories in a red wine bottle
title: How Many Calories in a Red Wine Bottle?
meta_description: Discover how many calories in a red wine bottle (standard 750 ml), including carbs, alcohol impact, and serving tips for 625 kcal total.
h1: How Many Calories in a Red Wine Bottle?
assumptions: Standard 750 ml bottle, dry red wine, 12-13% ABV, table wine like Cabernet or Merlot, no added sugars.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by wine type (dry/sweet), alcohol content, brand, vintage, and bottle size. Check labels or apps for specifics.

quick_answer.text: A standard 750 ml bottle of dry red wine has about 623 calories, mostly from alcohol and minimal carbs.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Fortified red wine like Port (20% ABV)

faqs.q: How many calories in a glass of red wine from a bottle?
faqs.a: About 125 kcal per 150 ml glass (5 glasses per standard bottle).

faqs.q: Does red wine have carbs or sugars?
faqs.a: Dry red wine has ~2.6 g carbs and 0.6 g sugars per 100 ml; totals ~20 g carbs per bottle.

faqs.q: Why are calories in red wine mostly from alcohol?
faqs.a: Alcohol provides 7 kcal/g; at 12-13% ABV, it accounts for ~85% of calories, with rest from carbs.

faqs.q: How does bottle size affect calories in red wine?
faqs.a: A 750 ml bottle is ~623 kcal; half-bottle (375 ml) is ~312 kcal, magnum (1.5 L) doubles to ~1,246 kcal.

faqs.q: Are there low-calorie red wine options?
faqs.a: Yes, drier, lower-ABV reds or 'light' wines can be 70-80 kcal per 100 ml vs standard 83 kcal.
